FAQ
. Otros enlaces:
1
2
Study of data set

The format is .csv (comma separate values)
The name of the file has the following nomenclatura yyyymmddhhmm_datos.csv. Thus, it could help extracting useful information at parsing time when reusing the data set contained in the dataset.
Example. The file 201102121900_datos.csv means the data are from the year 2011, the month of february, on the 12 at 19:00.
For more example of a "decoded" data
08001,A CORUÑA, --Estación con su código (cfr. tabla maestro.csv)
43.366944, -8.419167: coordenadas
1297554600000, 1297555200000: rango de milisegundos desde el 1 de enero de 1970 al que se refieren las mediciones.
ALT=58.0, --Altitud
VV10m=5.0, --Velocidad media del viento (m/s)
QVV10m=0, ---no identificado
DV10m=202, --Dirección media del viento (grados)
QDV10m=0, --no identificado
RVIENTO=30.0, --Recorrido del viento
QRVIENTO=0, --No identificado
VMAX10m=11.3, --Velocidad máxima del viento m/s
QVMAX10m=0, --No identificado
DMAX10m=228, --Dirección de la velocidad máxima del viento (grados)
QDMAX10m=0, --no identificado
TA=11.3, --Temperatura del aire (grado)
QTA=0, --no identificado
HR=74,--Humedad relativa(%)
QHR=0,-- no identificado
REC=0.0, --no identificado
QPREC=0, --no identificado
PRES=1005.5, --Presión (hPa)
QPRES=0, --no identificado
TPR=6.8, --Temperatura del punto de rocío (%)
QTPR=0, -- no identificado
PRES_nmar=1013.6, --Presión reducida al nivel del mar
QPRES_nmar=0 --no identificado
Not all the stations presented in the dataset are filled with the same attributes.
Time spend: 3 hours
Q+Acronym refers to the quality of the data. The possible values are:
0: Pasa todos los filtros.
2: El dato se considera sospechoso.
3: El dato podría ser erróneo.

RDF Publication

To publish the data in RDF it is necessary to install two tools:
Virtuoso
(Triple Store which stores the rdf data and provides a SPARQL endpoint) and
link Pubby
(to query the data from the repository in a viesual way instead of having to send sparql queries to the endpoint).
SPARQLEndpoint
http://aemet.linkeddata.es/sparql
Graphs
Graph Name:
http://aemet.linkeddata.es/data
Los datos generados por Mora
Viewer
http://geo.linkeddata.es:8282/aemet/
Installing Virtuoso

We have run Virtuoso in Windows and Linux. Here we summarize the steps to make them work
Virtuoso in Linux

Go to this
link
and download the application. Extract it in a folder and run the install.sh script.
Go to
http://localhost:8890/sparql
to check that everything went all right.
If you go to
http://localhost:8890
it will redirect you to the admin console. There you can import new graphs and see which ones you have already in your database.
Virtuoso in Windows

Follow the steps in the tutorial made by Boris:
http://virtuoso.openlinksw.com/dataspace/dav/wiki/Main/VOSUsageWindows
Download:
http://sourceforge.net/projects/virtuoso/files/virtuoso/6.1.2/virtuso-opensourcewin32-6.1.2.zip/download
ODBC Registration: Set up VIRTUOSO_HOME variable pointing out to virtuoso-opensource directory:
cd %VIRTUOSO_HOME%\lib
regsvr32 virtodbc.dll
Creating a Windows Service
cd %VIRTUOSO_HOME%\database
SET PATH=%PATH%;%VIRTUOSO_HOME%\bin;%VIRTUOSO_HOME%\lib
virtuoso-t -? //to verify
virtuoso-t +service screate +instance "Instance Name" +configfile virtuoso.ini
virtuoso-t +service list //to verify
virtuoso-t -I "Instance Name" +service start //start the service
Virtuoso Web Admin Tool (conductor)
http://localhost:8890/conductor
Installing Pubby

(The same installation steps are necessary for Windows and Linux).
You need Apache Tomcat in order to make Pubby work. It can be downloaded from
here
You only need to extract the folder anywhere you want.
Start the Tomcat (go to /bin and execute the startup.bat (Windows) or startup.sh (linux)).
Open your browser and go to
http://localhost:8080
to check that the tomcat works fine.
Then you have to download pubby from
here
. Extract the files in a new folder.
Copy Pubby's "webApp" folder into the Apache Tomcat's "webapps" folder. It must be renamed (e.g. pubby).
Edit Pubby's configuration file. It is located in webapps/<Name of your pubby folder>/WEB-INF/config.n3 The extension of the file may vary depending on the version of Pubby.
The Pubby Configuration File
speaker: SYSTEM
